case.state: Welcome. Are you prepared for a fantastic game?
All will fall before the might of Turandot.
Nothing wrong with going forward as a group, of course. I'm sure spells are just as effective either way...
Good grief... Not another suitor already in the buff... Put on some clothes first. Really!
I'm afraid you've got it all wrong, dear Wikipe-tan. I've since expanded. An entire Dungeon of Death is greatly preferable to simple riddles. Much better for all parties involved.
So this is it? Very well. If anyone falls maddeningly in love tonight only to have their heart broken at the slightest hint of rejection, stuff your face with assorted chocolates and call it a night.
Is this what they're calling a mansion these days? How... quaint.
If I had only known we were going to a recreational spa, I'd have dressed without such pomp.
Is the dark lighting of the room for ambience or is it because some of you might look better in the dark?
Was holding this event at a beach a sort of incentive? It's certainly made me feel far overdressed.
I think this diversity gives a fairly nice opportunity for any latent homoerotic fascinations we might have otherwise kept to ourselves.
I am not some exorbitant decoration left here to be scrutinized and belittled as the petty likes of you. You all will treat me with the utmost respect lest I show you the might of Turandot.
Let's not be trite with our openings. Should we all introduce ourselves with pick-up lines or jump straight to confessions of true love?
I have heard small talk before, and I have found no need for it. Let us play.
Do you desire to possess me? To make me your own? Now we'll be having none of that in this game, won't we?
...Ah ha. Well...
Oh dear...
I'll keep them.
You've given me good cards at last!
I'll have no tampering with my hand.
I think not.
Go on. Next person.
Not a good card in that hand...
Remove these!
Feh. Good riddance.
Burn it down and begin again.
A lone straggler.
Always an odd one out.
This one alone.
The one. Just the one.
Hand me ~cards.text~.
~Cards.text~. This is not a request.
Trade them out. Yes, these ~cards.text~.
Servant! These ~cards.text~!
Do not pity these ~cards.text~.
These ~cards.text~. Away with them!
Give me ~cards.text~. ...Please.
These ~cards.text~. Go.
Just these ~cards.text~.
Yes, yes. these ~cards.text~.
Just take them.
Well... exchange these.
Oh, let's go with... ~cards.text~.
I have lost far too many times already. I do not intend to do so again.
The cycle of loss has been broken as all things that block my path shall be!
It's only the first round and fortune has already picked a favorite. This doesn't bode well for you at all.
I do expect to win this first round. And the next. And the one after that. You'll see the pattern soon enough.
When I spoke of the power of Turandot I did not imagine it to be this effective.
At this rate I should just sit down and grab some dates with almond paste for a snack.
I'll admit, I'm almost amused.
Big words said today. Let us put them to the test...
I advise you all not to cheat. The integrity of a game is not something that should be forsaken impulsively.
Be careful not to mix love and lust while you're here. You may not live to regret it.
Heed my warning. I am a flagitious woman who is not afraid to step on others as need be.
Face me and meet your doom. I am the end of all things.
You can mince words until they're a fine pâté, but they are no match for the truth found in these cards.
Look deep in my eyes and what do you see? Fire. Power. Death. But you will never see mercy.
I am a woman, a symbol of life, by birth. Yet I am a symbol of death by my own hands!
It's not about how you set up your great plans. It's always about execution.
I enjoy crafting riddles when I get free time. It doesn't come up all that often, but what is a hobby if not for one's own personal satisfaction?
Every one of my ladies-in-waiting has a "tell". It is only a matter of time before I figure you all out, and you become notes in my head.
Let's make sure that we keep a good distance here. I enjoy my personal space, but I also know that most of my suitors love my personal space.
It's nice to be able to play a game. I'm never approached with offers to do anything fun like this.
I will be the slightest bit merciful... I do love a good game.
I never understood the suitors who would shower me with their wealth. I'm already the sole heir to an empire, I've no use for trinkets. What can you offer me, as a person?
I wonder how many of these choices are "real", so to speak. Is there ever a player with such low luck in a round that there is no possible way I could fail?
I would say it'd be against the spirit of the game to "deal someone back in." Why watch people remove their clothes if there was a chance they'd get to put them back on?
I should put this bluntly: this is not a date. I don't know if any of you thought it was or that we would look back on this and call it a date, but no.
I do not always mean to mock you. It is, however, a fun coincidence if you feel mocked.
Ah, the odd pleasant surprise should never be turned down.
Well, I'll at least enjoy my approaching win. You are welcome to join me.
Let us see if you and your words can manage to weasel your way out of this!
The wisest poker player in the world could not defeat this hand. And, well, let's be honest: none of you are anywhere near that level.
I dreamt the other night that I held a pair of scales. I suppose judgment now hangs in the balance.
As usual, I await your applause.
Turns out that years of intensely studying strategy and diplomacy might just turn out to be useful.
Do you believe in reading tea leaves to tell the future?
You'll assuredly lose this hand. Should I draw my finger across my throat and make a Gckkhk sound?
This may be such a good hand that you all might accuse me of cheating, though I'd rather you wouldn't, so we won't have to go through that rigmarole.
I've read somewhere about joy's commutative nature, though I suspect not all of us will react as content as others to my win.
How delightful. Failure may once again elude me.
I say now that you should all accept your losses with poise and dignity, unless watching you lose turns out to be extraordinarily amusing. Then feel free to openly weep.
And with this the game has begun. It's not too late to save your dignities if you get cold feet...
I should warn you early on that any acts of "true love" or "unbridled passion" towards me or anyone else will be met with swift and excruciating insults.
It would be wise not to speak unless spoken to. Except if you wish to reveal your hand to me.
Hmph. I do not like giving up my fate to the specter of chance...
If you continue to insist on this fool's errand, then at least bother to pick up some milk while you're out.
I typically only allow other nobles to see my face. Does their refined birth make them better suitors? Sadly, no. But are they more classically handsome with chiseled features? Also no.
I am prepared to vanquish those who oppose me! Regardless of cards! Regardless of fate!
No sense in delaying any longer. The game is afoot, so to speak.
A love of games has taken me to many a strange experience, yet not one so public and lurid as this one here.
I've trained animals for long enough that I know that gaining new skills takes time. ...And treats.
You can often tell what others are thinking without them saying a word. If you know what you're looking for, that is.
For a strong piece of advice: learn people's names. It may help greatly in the long run.
Come to think of it... "playing cards" isn't a bad answer to a riddle. I'll have to workshop it before adding it to the riddles section of my dungeon, of course.
Do you think you can know me? That you can simply know my every thought just from this one game? I am not so eager to give myself away.
Watching the delusions of others isn't without its charms, so long as they don't directly interfere with me.
Does your heart burn with passion? Do you have a pang in your chest? Have you tried taking something for indigestion?
I used to bring my cat, Tibor, with me to all social events. I stopped a few months ago after a noble saw Tibor start to snuggle in my lap, and I heard the man mumble "God, I wish that were me."
I've considered changing from a Dungeon of Death to one-on-one sword fights. I'm not keen on giving the suitor a weapon, but I'm sure the in-combat banter would make it oh-so worth it.
...By the way. You all won't bring this up with any of my servants or workers will you? I have a reputation as a good employer to maintain.
It'd be nice if we could have a little tea to drink. I can see the practical problem of having to hold both the cup and our cards at once, but I do crave a good jasmine.
I hope everyone ate before coming here. For myself, I had my chef whip up a nice pineapple and pomegranate smoothie. It does wonders for the body.
Game idea: let's give vague hints about what our hands are like! So much more fun that way.
I think we've had enough games, and I love games.
Perhaps you would be so kind as to throw a round or two?
I know, I know... Will I win? Will I lose? Oh, the suspense is maddening!
Have some confidence in the rules. I'm not out of this just yet, and I don't plan to be any time soon.
Sometimes getting what you want isn't about working for it but simply eliminating all obstacles in your path...
I do appreciate open and honest feedback. Too showy, not showy enough... You don't get the best Dungeon of Death in an entire empire on your first go around.
If I continue to lose, then you'll all join a select group to see me pleasure myself. Current members include my house cat and a lady in waiting who doesn't know how to knock.
I think any stabs I might make at using seduction would be marked as transparent the moment I'd attempt them. Though it may not hurt to try...
Huh. Over the years, the label suitors have projected on me has changed so much. "Femme fatale", "manic pixie death girl", "murder mommy"...
It's not that I couldn't have soldiers break in here to save me from having to go any further... It'd just be so against the spirit of it all.
I've never been one for speech writers. People already try to put words in my mouth, so why start paying them?
I haven't the slightest idea where people start rumors about me. I've heard everything from making a Faustian bargain to having a third nipple. And it's quite obvious how true those are.
(Do I have any scrolls hidden on me? It'd be such a mood killer to have them fall out.)
Hmph... I am Turandot. I do not have to worry about a single measly loss early on.
I am surprised that it has taken so long before my inevitable loss of clothing.
I might ask for more challenging opponents in the future, seeing as how fate and luck have clearly aligned with my own wants.
I loathe this hand.
In case anyone was holding their breath, the number of opening lines that have swept me off my feet and made me fall maddeningly in love remains zero.
I hope that in a place like this I won't be swarmed by people swept in the feelings of love or at the very least they can sort themselves out before taking it too far.
I know that you do not take me for a fool.
Never look upon me and expect to see weakness!
If I am to lose, then I lose by my own hand.
Your nefarious plans to see me undressed will not be seen through to fruition.
I have never been swayed by even the grandest of heartfelt pleas, so what makes you think I will back down to a paltry bad hand?
My fate is mine alone to control. I will not allow it to fall into overeager hands.
I've been told "she's so cute when she's angry." It is then that I resolve to contain my anger as best I can.
No. No no no. This is all wrong!
I am not one to be outdone.
I bear the burden of an empire that stretches the known world. Do you not think I would be able to take a loss in stride?
Love can make one do the most incredibly stupid things: risk life and limb, lose all sense of dignity, purposefully throw a round of a card game?
There's no feasible way to say to someone here "I really just want to get to know the real you" without seeming gauche, is there?
Tell me all of your feelings of love and loss, and I'll return to tell you where you can stick it.
I've found it common that people expect me to have knives on my person. It's fitting but so impractical. Imagine washing a dress without removing the blades; it'd be ripped apart!
A palace cannot be weak. It must look as if it will last forever, same as its ruler. Unfortunately, I am but a human.
We only fear for the result because we have made a choice. If we were not asked to exchange cards, I would feel no worry, for it would be only up to fate.
Getting some of you to swap hands is more tedious than convincing someone their food isn't poisoned. "It's fine. Nothing bad will happen. I promise." Just wasting everyone's time.
Careful, you might pull a muscle from patting yourself on the back too hard.
Perhaps we shouldn't be held to our past mistakes...
A simple yes or no question: Do you believe in giving people second chances? What about a third chance? ...Perhaps even a seventh chance, if they've slipped up enough?
Most people start babbling nonsense about my beauty when I'm fully clothed... Everyone should be passed out on the floor by this point...
Grrah... Someone bring me a rulebook! There must be some sort of a loophole or something in there...
Is this the end of Turandot?
Is it once again time for everyone's favorite game of "tame the shrew"?
Is that your final answer?
Turandot cannot fail. Not the woman: she has doubts, fears, and failures like all the rest. It's the image, the unstoppable princess you've made perfect in your own mind. She cannot fail.
Should I make a big show of things if I lose? Maybe give people some schadenfreude.
There are worse things than losing, you know. Annoying questions, when a beloved outfit doesn't fit anymore, military coups...
No no... I can think of a way through this. Just... give me a minute.
Forget I said anything... No spell. Honest. You're all doing much better than the other people I've stripped down in front of, so... that's good, at least?
...None of you know me, do you? How inopportune. Secrets always do find a way to rise to the surface, whether you'd like them to or not.
...None of you know me, do you? ...It appears my reputation does not precede me...
It can simply be said that I carry a... vested long-term interest in the more thrilling sides of life, sustained by routine checks into the goings-on of local houses of ill repute.
There's no sense in facing away from us, dear. Face the gauntlet of social interaction like the rest of us.
An important note about my Dungeon of Death: the suitors are free to leave whenever they want. I do not hold them against their will and do tell them the deadly consequences of continuing.
"Go through a Dungeon of Death," eh? I can make that happen, Yuno. Granted, it is rather perilous. I don't slap "of Death" on things without just cause. But I will send you through if you like, boy.
Luck will only get you so far, Yuno. But I am nothing if not accommodating. So, if you are really, truly, utterly, 100%, without any doubt certain... No shame in backing out... We will play.
(I think she set that one up on purpose. Petty sniping is no fun when the subject has decided to wear a target on their really fat posterior.)
If my ever-present musings about my lot in life crosses into a compliment, then bully for you, I suppose.
Yes, the presence of wanton feelings that drive me to eat is nothing compared to the continued employment of tailors...
The feeling is not mutual, Erufuda.
(Just ignore her, Turandot, and she might go away. Besides, I might just have to take a double trip to the sauna to get rid of the headache she's giving me.)
Pronouncing my name wrong... Come now, Erufuda. How old are you?
And should I assume now, Miss Erufuda, that you will cease talking unless addressed? As per my instructions, of course.
Treats, Erufuda? Treats are small items, typically edible, that are used as a stimulus to encourage a desired reaction. Frankly, I'm surprised you didn't know that.
Treats, Erufuda? Dates filled with a delicious almond paste served with jasmine tea or the souls of the innocent. Joking of course. Souls and dates are completely different palates.
Oh, I'll take what I believe is mine, Erufuda. You mustn't worry about that.
On a personal level, Erufuda, I'd agree. Of course, when royalty begins to take too many indulgences, things begin to get... risky.
...Twenty? Of course. How foolish of me to ask for one's age when the tradition of women being uncomfortable with the passage of time reigns supreme!
Still no, Erufuda. Your argument seems to rest on the idea that I'd want to wear pajamas in public. Which, I should state clearly, I do not.
"Feast days?" Do you, Erufuda, have days specifically related to gorging yourself?
I think I'll be my own judge on how comfortable I am in my skin at whatever size I shall be, Erufuda.
Mmm... perhaps, Erufuda. Though one can only wish that it did more. The challenges have not stopped and neither will my weight, should I not be careful.
Well, go on... charm me, Erufuda. Right now. You seem confident in your skills.
I realize that my earlier persona was a little extravagant, but this is a farce, plain and simple, Erufuda.
I should also find the treatment of others that I used through describing a bath to be much more serious business.
How certain we are, Erufuda, that years of trauma may melt off so thanks to bubbles and perhaps a nice rubber duck.
Well, then keep eating, Erufuda. Stuff your face full for all I care...
If you're willing to let me indulge your question, Senko, at their last moments they were out of my hands. Before that, they had every comfort, anything they could ever want: except for me.
It's nice that they keep an air of refinery here. Considering the inevitable...
This low ambient light is doing wonders for all of your complexions. It's much harder to see your pores now!
My father actually has a mountainside home quite similar to this, though I've tended to stay away until his condition improves...
I do enjoy a nice little ditty from time to time... Sing on!
I once had a suitor attempt to woo me by holding up a bard over his head in front of my balcony for several hours. This did not work, however, as I was away at the time.
If I had anything close to a good singing voice, you could not imagine the stage productions I'd put on.
"Villain" songs are very in right now. I'd like to have one myself, someday.
If it'll keep you all from trying to sneak peeks, here it is: my ass.
Oh, I wouldn't think for a second that some of you didn't come here to peek at some woman's butt.
Isn't this what you wanted? Well, go on, bask in its glory, or whatever fanciful radiance you were imagining.
Don't get me wrong, love and lust have their place here. I simply hate how false they can be. The façade that mistakes one emotion for the other is the most lecherous dishonesty.
You'll never hear a sonnet written about playing cards or games. Instead, it's always love and other trivial matters. Frankly, I think the poets are missing out.
I'd... like to apologize for my outburst earlier. I shouldn't have assumed that you knew me. That was my own fault.
Was the referring to myself in the third person a bit much? It feels like it was a bit much... I'll workshop it.
A vastly underrated quality in a partner is the ability to "commit to a bit." Just imagine it: you make a joke and without the slightest signal your lover joins in to become a comedy duo!
I'm still not entirely convinced that we should be doing this outdoors... though the breeze is nice.
Call me traditionalist but playing strip poker outside doesn't have the intimate flair of the indoors.
I should spend more time outside. The palace grounds are lovely this time of year.
This place has a scent of love in the air. How wonderful.
I do not understand how a place can foster the feelings of love. Surely it's all a façade. The bonds of human intimacy are not forged of rose petals and cheap wine.
This place... It's bright, it's outside. Where's the intrigue? Where's the cover of darkness to step out of in various stages of undress?
What I wouldn't give to have a beach like this near my palace... I suppose I'll just have to build one.
I had an architect who wanted to build a beach like this in one of my pit traps for the crocodiles. Most ridiculous thing I'd ever heard. So many logistic errors in one plan.
Of course, I do not fear my suitors. Why should I be forced to hide from them? Do I not have a right to go out? A right to express myself sexually? A right to not be harassed?
I am not inclined to think that it's because of my nobility. Perhaps it's a part, but even other nobles are known to launch at my skirts. What drives them is beyond my understanding.
The only thing this crown has given me is headaches and a mild fear of assassination. Though, if you want some nobles to tell off I can send for some, and we'll make a day of it.
I could give any number of reasons for my coming here. Intimacy, boredom, a sense of risk, maybe I just like seeing people I don't know feel shame. Do any of those work for you?
It's quite alright, Leonie. It's rather strange to be a noble here. Though I hope my status does not warrant some mindless etiquette or perceived special treatment.
You are welcome, Heris. I am a princess under my father, the emperor, may he live a thousand years.
Oh, good. You've let me know about your presumed intent to steal or coerce me out of my money. Step one done. Tell me: what's step two in your master plan here?
Flattery will get you nowhere, dear. This outfit of mine is a uniform, same as any other. I assume that your ensemble isn't what you wear casually either.
Aren't we over-eager? Though I should warn you that it is marry. You will marry me. Consummation will still be up to me.
It's a good thing that personalities are so disposable then, Reimu. I will simply conjure a new one out of the thin air. I'm sure this one will suit you much better.
...Well, Aaravi. I suppose you wouldn't have to marry me. It is state policy, but of course I supersede that. I will still warn you... Spikes do not care much for the beliefs of the foolhardy.
I do reject them. They simply do not accept the rejection. If you kick them out forcibly, they raise an enormous ruckus out in the streets and foment discontent and insurrection.
And you expect me to know, Erufuda? Whatever fantasy it is that goes on in their heads, I do not pretend to understand.

You've solved it, Erufuda! I'm just hungry all of the time! Surely having them all make me a meal won't be seen as leading them on! Nonsense! Too busy trying to keep my girlish figure that I missed it!
Are you trying to flirt with me? By positing that rejecting men who forced themselves on me, into my home, must mean that I prefer the other sex? Are you that incompetent?
Oh, on occasion. Much more rare but women can try the same as any man can. Just don't tell me that this is some sly way of saying you're interested in an attempt.
I was not under the preconception that you would be so acquainted with royalty. You are speaking about true royals and not some flippant title of an otherwise unknown?
Love is almost always a misnomer. They do not love you. They admire, revere, crave, desire, worship, covet, envy, and praise you. But not love. Hardly ever love.
I'd like to say that I'm a woman of my word... but I'm not entirely sure. It is hard to tell what one will do in the moment. Betray them... Help them... You never know until it happens.
You have no idea of the ways suitors have reacted to rejection. Prostrating themselves, spiteful rage, relentless sobbing. Have they no sense of control? Of dignity?
My family? I have been assured that I descend from a long and proud line of ancestors... Though the reigning subterfuge within my own lifetime leads me to believe otherwise.
Let's see... Spike pit, crocodile, spears from the floor, crushing rocks, riddles with an executioner... Truly a mishmash from reiterating on it so many times. I have a staff who takes care of it.
I simply do not want their affection. It's been years of this, since before I was of age. The dungeon is a last resort, only for those who "would rather die than live without me." Their words.
It's rather annoying, isn't it? How much they believe you owe them your attention and time. Violence does stop them in the immediate... but they come back. My method is... permanent, of course.
If you asked my citizens... they'd call me aloof. I rarely appear, governing from within palace walls. But I am with them. I travel the streets in secret and know their strife.
Oh, I have several. My spaniels, my cat, Tibor... but the crown jewel has to be King Croc. He's a bit of a pain to feed and care for, but I just can't resist how adorable he is.
Girl talk? Very well. I suppose I want honesty. I have an addiction to truth. So many suitors spin lies that they use to try and trick me. They attempt to play me rather than play with me.
Ah... well, I am often tempted to observe the more thrilling sides of life, Nami. So, a hooded trip to the local red-light district, just to observe, is a bit of a debauched way to unwind.
The ever-present struggle of whether to have you remain quiet or quiver as you bumble through errant titles. I kid. The name Turandot alone will suffice.
I kill them. Were you not paying attention? Another joke. In truth, the dungeon works such that it weeds through the liars and the false.
Considering your attitude, would you say that friendship is something important to you, Nodoka? Imperial life does not carve out much room for friends like that.
Sleeping. Fewer stupid questions and and pesky suitors in the land of dreams.
There aren't any blood relatives left to abdicate to, but that is beside the point. Why should I give up power? They annoy, but not so much to give up what I work so hard to maintain.
Alas, no matter what cheap, black leather they wear or what oil those women rub on themselves, it isn't enough. It simply has to be the princess.
Oh, that sounds like quite the opportunity. Let them boast and show off first. Get their hopes high. I like to use a cheering crowd. Trust me, it makes the rest of it much more fun.
Ah, but you realize that leadership means controlling emotions. Theater and flair are emotional control. You need tactical soldiers, I need an invigorated populace. You fill the role you need.
Oh, I think you'll find royalty to be quite congenial, Kaz. Our servants put our pants on one leg at a time, same as everyone else.
No, not this time. Too much capital up front. Truthfully, dungeons are really more trouble than they're worth to build and maintain. Though, I can still threaten to have you killed, if you like.
In my younger years... I engaged in the dating game far more. Suppose I should return sooner rather than later. I'd hate to try again at that arbitrary threshold where you're deemed past prime.
Princess. Princess Turandot. I hate to bear bad news, but the presence of nobility means little to me, no matter how "kind of" it is. Good birth speaks nothing of good... well, anything else.
Well, partially right. You're welcome to give it another go, if you see fit.
That's no way to introduce yourself to someone, young lady. You should at least fake being cordial. Deriding comments must be saved until you know details on a person worth being mocked.
To know Turandot is to know fear. You would be advised to keep that in mind, Ringo. I am not to be trifled with.
You're getting awfully presumptuous about how I spend my finances. I'd advise you to think very hard before you continue.
I suppose I like it well enough. It is perhaps not what I would wear should I have infinite choice, but I should think it well enough.
...I can well and see that we are opposites, more than just in title. Though if we are to focus on titles, you may want to workshop yours. "Sexiness" is a mouthful. Try something punchier.
I once tried to have a court jester. Didn't take. Perhaps he should have made even more dick jokes.
I do not know of any other Turandots, Ladybug.
That, of course, depends on what you've heard about me.
While I don't know from where you picked up such an opinion, but perhaps I can elucidate.
Suddenly taking an interest in my social life, are we?
Poor baby. Poor, poor baby for you all. You have to be terribly lonely to come here. Don't worry, though. I'm here for you.
Don't you wish to fall under the power of the love witch? I only long to give my lovers everything they're ever wanted.
I think everyone has some secret, fantastical desires... to find true love, to fly, to have a sexy, messed-up girl on your arm.
You know, there's one thing that I don't like about men, and about people in general: it's when people decide to make overly obscure references.
I simply can't explain why I'm not in a relationship. I lock myself away, I use love magic, I put people in harm's way to get sincerity out of the emotionally stunted... and nothing!
I suppose I can give this one last try. No spells. No death traps. Just... look into my eyes.
Well, after all that excitement... how about we put our attention elsewhere? A little party game to spice up the small talk with some personal anecdotes? I'll ask the first question.
I am sure by now you all know me. I am Turandot, Princess of Death!
Do you all see me? Do you attempt to know me? A farce to be sure. I am Turandot: Princess of Death!
I know that you have heard of my beauty and are waiting to catch me at a moment of vulnerability, to swoop in and console me! Am I not up for the taking?
I do not like to repeat myself: I am not cute. Whatever vision of me is in your head, dispose of it at once.
I know what you must be thinking: this is just some "evil bitch" veneer that will melt away and reveal a sweet little princess underneath.
I'd think it unwise to think me anything close to a murderous maniac. After all, I'm your opponent in this game of cards. We should be civil, no?
I should make it clear: I do not want to hear any declarations of love here. You're only embarrassing yourself.
I should say, it is rather peculiar having a direct conversation with you all. There's no batting around of power as with dignitaries or servants. It's certainly unlike talking to my suitors.
Hmph... I must say that you all continue a contemptible trend: Those who wish to see me, but do not want to see me.
I know you all want to see me trip up. Perhaps you get a sense of satisfaction, or you find it humanizes me, whatever it is...
I am reminded of my latest correspondence with the Prince of Persia, who is now, unfortunately, dead.
Know that I do not believe you all to be co-conspirators working together to eliminate me. Mostly I'm kicking myself for not thinking of doing that first.
Whenever I'm meeting new people I feel like it's always either "You're so beautiful! Marry me!" or "Why do you have a dungeon of death?" No one ever asks if I've taken up a new hobby.
